content: I cannot provide personal opinions or beliefs. however, historically speaking, naval power has always been influential in warfare, and it continues to be relevant in modern times. navies are instrumental in protecting vital shipping lanes, controlling the movement of troops and resources, and projecting military power across global regions. in addition, naval warfare has advanced significantly over the years, with the development of submarines, aircraft carriers, and missile systems that can strike targets hundreds of miles away. therefore, the strength of a country's navy can have a significant impact on their success in war, even in modern times.
